problem.markdown:
1. Constant head method is suitable for _________ type of soils (x) Coarse grained soils () Fine grained soils () Cohesive soils () Cohesion less soils
2) Variable head test is suitable for _______ type of soils () Coarse grained soils (x) Fine grained soils () Cohesive soils () Cohesion less soils
3) Which test is used to find the coefficient of permeability of a partially saturated soil () Constant head method () Variable head test (x) Capillary permeability test () Consolidation test data
4) For a fully saturated soil ______ is the permeability (x) More () Less () Zero () Both a and b
5) Coefficient of permeability by variable head test is given by (x) k=al/At ln(h1/h2) () k=a/At ln(h2/h1) () k=al/At ln(h2/h1) () k=a/At ln(h1/h2)
6) If size of the particle increases 2 times then K increases to (x) 4 Times () 2 Times () Decreases () Remains same
7) Soil with largest void ratio have ______permeability (x) Less () More () Equal () Zero
8) Due to change of temperature, the ᵞw and µ of the liquid reduced by 10% and 40% respectively. What is the change in the permeability of the soil () Reduces by 10% () Reduces by 90% () Reduces by 40% (x) Both a and b
9) Coefficient of permeability is also called as (x) Hydraulic conductivity () Conductivity () Energy of water () Potential of water
